meanings.definition: To fill or close up a hole or gap with a substance
meanings.sent1: I am plugging the leak in the pipe with some putty.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter is plugging the cracks in the wall with plaster.
meanings.sent3: After plugging the hole in the boat, it stopped taking on water.
meanings.sent4: She was plugging the gaps in her knowledge by studying diligently.
meanings.sent5: The detective was plugging away at the case until he found the missing clue.

meanings.sent1: The company is plugging their new product on social media.
meanings.sent2: He is plugging his upcoming concert on the radio.
meanings.sent3: Plugging the event, she made sure everyone knew about it.
meanings.sent4: The politician was plugging his campaign promises during the speech.
meanings.sent5: The actress was plugging her latest movie in interviews.

meanings.definition: To work diligently or persistently at a task
meanings.sent1: She is plugging away at her homework to finish it on time.
meanings.sent2: The team is plugging through the tough project with determination.
meanings.sent3: Plugging at the puzzle, he finally solved it after hours.
meanings.sent4: The artist was plugging at the painting until it was perfect.
meanings.sent5: He kept plugging at the problem until he found a solution.
